avalancheActivity.comment: Small slab avalanche was discovered in Bláfjöll on the 22nd of February along with many minor cornice collapses and movement.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Intense rainfall is expected in the mountains early Monday that will compromise snowpack stability. A little bit of new dry snow is on top of older freeze-thaw snow since early this week. Instability has been discovered between these snow types that could have developed in the frost this weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow subsided and melted in thaw since Saturday. This old snow is expected to be generally homogeneous and stable in most places. If should stiffen and strengthen even more in cold temperatures. The little new dry snow on top may bond poorly with underlying freeze-thaw snow. An extended column test in Bláfjöll 22nd of feb. gave a fracture that propagated at medium load on a slush layer between stiffer slabs. In these conditions, large avalanches are not expected but gullies and depressions that have gathered much new snow can be dangerous. Thawing weather on Monday will temporarily compromise stability in the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in north-facing slopes during the Tuesday night snowfall and on Tuesday morning in North and East parts. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw throughout the country, and has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs form on N-aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talsverðri úrkomu er spáð í suðlægum áttum með hlýindum aðfaranótt mánudags. Mest rigning til fjalla. Lítilháttar slydda og él á þriðjudag í V áttum með auknu frosti. Lægir og styttir upp með miðvikudeginum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many small avalanches released in Kirkjubólshlíð, probably in the rain the night before Wednesday 20.2. The largest avalanche stopped 50 m above the road. Small sluffs released in the area in warm weather more then a week ago.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow that fell after Wednesday may have formed unstable wind slabs on top of stiff and generally stable snow, especially in S-W aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow that fell in the second half of the week, especially on Thursday, and drifted in strong NE winds can have formed new unstable wind slabs on top of older stable snow, especially in S-W aspects. A thaw is expected on Monday that will affect the snow up to mountain tops, but then winds turn to north with colder temps and snowshowers.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in north-facing slopes during the Tuesday night snowfall and on Tuesday morning in North and East parts. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw throughout the country, and has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs form on N-aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýst í hvassa suðlæga átt aðfaranótt mánudags, fyrst með ákafri snjókomu en fer svo í slyddu og rigningu. Kólnar á þriðjudag og snýst í norðlæga átt mé éljum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Few small slab avalanches fell in Ólafsfjörður and by Ólafsfjarðarvegur and Dalvík on Thursday when it snowed intensely in NW winds and later the same day when NNE winds picked up. Around 300m wide slab was seen in Burstabrekkudalur on the 19th of february that likely fell in the warming episode last weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A weak layer is present in the snowpack that could spread out in case of an avalanche. It snowed in the mountains throughout Friday in N-winds and wind slabs in S-aspects have grown. They could also grow in N-aspects as a warming episode is expected for Monday in strong S-winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow settled in the warming episode last weekend but still a weak layer is persistent in the mountains. Stability tests from two snowpits in a NE facing hill in Klettahnjúkur and a SE facing hill in Illviðrihnjúkur showed a sudden planar failure where a faceted layer and an ice layer were found. Little snow was added in a short period of NE-winds on Wednesday morning. On Thursday morning we had intense snowfall in easy NW-winds. Continous minor snowfall dominated Friday but it got dry and cold during the weekend. Early Monday it will get warmer and snow could subside in the lowlands.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in north-facing slopes during the Tuesday night snowfall and on Tuesday morning in North and East parts. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw throughout the country, and has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs form on N-aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: SSV hvassviðri 15-20 m/sek og úrkoma á mánudag með hlýindum sem gætu náð lítillega upp til fjalla. Snýr í norðlægar áttir með úrkomuskoti á þriðjudeginum. Rigning á láglendi en snjór til fjalla, vindur 10-15 m/sek.

avalancheActivity.comment: Skier triggered slab in Stafdalur, size 2. A slab avalanche released in Skagafell in Fagridalur 18/2 and wet loose avalanches released in Norðfjörður. Sowmobile triggered an avalanche above Fáskrúðsfjörður 14/2.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Skier triggered slab in Stafdalur. Windslabs likely on all aspects after snowfall and snowdrift from variable wind directions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow added in mountains on Wednesday and drifted in S-E winds. On Friday, snow fell and drifted in stiff NW winds. Wind slabs in most aspects. Skier triggered stiff slab in Stafdalur released on a shallow weeklayer within the windslab. Older snow subsided in warm weather in the first half of the week and weak layers gained strength. Older snow should now be generally stiff and stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: A significant amount of snow has melted into crust on Monday throughout the country, and thawing has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs could form in north-facing slopes during the Tuesday night snowfall and on Tuesday morning in North and East parts. Weaknesses in the upper snowpack have likely disappeared due to the thaw, but deeper weaknesses higher in the mountains could still be present in the North part of the country.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A significant amount of snow has melted during thaw throughout the country, and has reached up to the mountain tops in many areas. Wind slabs form on N-aspects during snow through Tuesday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss suðlæg átt á mánudga með hlýnandi veðri og smá vætu. Snýst aftur í N-NV átt á þriðjudga með kólnandi veðri, snjókomu/skafrenningi til fjalla en slyddu á láglendi.
